name: Abumi-guchi
description: A furry creature formed from the stirrup of a mounted military commander who worked for Yamata no Orochi.

name: Abura-akago
description: An infant ghost who licks the oil out of andon lamps.

name: Abura-sumashi
description: A spirit who lives on a mountain pass in Kumamoto Prefecture.

name: Aka Manto
description: A malicious spirit who haunts bathrooms and asks the cubicle occupants if they want red or blue paper.

name: Akabeko
description: A red cow involved in the construction of Enzō-ji in Yanaizu, Fukushima.

name: Akaname
description: A spirit who licks off filth in untidy bathrooms.

name: Akashita
description: A creature that looms in a black cloud over a floodgate.

name: Akateko
description: A red hand dangling out of a tree.

name: Akkorokamui
description: An Ainu monster resembling a fish or octopus.

name: Akurojin-no-hi
description: A ghostly fire from Mie Prefecture.

name: Amabie
description: A Japanese mermaid yokai.

name: Amaburakosagi
description: A ritual-disciplinary demon from Shikoku.

name: Amamehagi
description: A ritual-disciplinary demon from Hokuriku.

name: Amanojaku
description: A small demon that instigates people into wickedness.

name: Amanozako
description: A monstrous goddess mentioned in the Kujiki.

name: Amazake-babaa
description: An old woman who asks for sweet sake and brings disease.

name: Amefurikozō
description: A little boy spirit who plays in the rain.

name: Amemasu
description: An Ainu creature resembling a fish or whale.

name: Ameonna
description: A rain making female spirit.

name: Amikiri
description: A net-cutting bird-headed , crustacean armed , snake bodied spirit.

name: Amorōnagu
description: A Tennyo from the island of Amami Ōshima.

name: Amaterasu
description: A sun goddess.

name: Anmo
description: A ritual-disciplinary demon from Iwate Prefecture.

name: Aoandon
description: The demonic spirit which arises from an andon lamp at the end of a Hyakumonogatari Kaidankai.

name: Aobōzu
description: The blue monk who kidnaps children.

name: Aonyōbō
description: A female ghost who lurks in an abandoned imperial palace.

name: Aosaginohi
description: A luminescent heron.

name: Arikura-no-baba
description: An old woman with magical powers.

name: Ashimagari
description: A spirit which entangles the legs of travelers.

name: Ashinagatenaga
description: A pair of characters, one with long legs and the other with long arms.

name: Ayakashi (yōkai)
description: A phenomenon considered to be the funayurei.

name: Azukiarai
description: A spirit that washes azuki beans.

name: Bake-kujira
description: A ghostly whale skeleton that drifts along the coastline of Shimane Prefecture.

name: Bakeneko
description: A shape-shifting cat.

name: Bakezōri
description: A zori straw sandal spirit.

name: Baku (spirit)|Baku
description: An auspicious beast who can devour nightmares.

name: Basan
description: A large fire-breathing chicken monster.

name: Betobeto-san
description: Invisible spirit which follows people at night, making the sound of footsteps.

name: Binbōgami
description: The spirit of poverty.

name: Biwa-bokuboku
description: Animated biwa lute.

name: Byakko
description: Japanese version of the Chinese White Tiger.

name: Chōchinobake
description: A possessed chōchin lantern.

name: Chōchinbi
description: Demonic flames which appear in footpaths between rice-fields.

name: Daidarabotchi
description: A giant responsible for creating the geographical features of Japan.

name: Daitengu
description: The most powerful tengu, each of whom lives on a separate mountain.

name: Danzaburou-danuki
description: a tanuki from Sado Island.

name: Datsue-ba
description: An old woman in the Underworld who removes clothes (or skin if unclothed) of the dead.

name: Dodomeki
description: A hundred-eyed demon.

name: Enenra
description: A monster made of smoke.

name: Kappa (folklore)|Enkō
description: Kappa of Shikoku and western Honshū.

name: Fūjin
description: The wind god.

name: Fūri
description: A monkey-like yokai.

name: Funayūrei
description: Ghosts of people who died at sea.

name: Furaribi
description: A creature  engulfed in flames that flies aimlessly.

name: Furutsubaki-no-rei
description: A soul-sucking plant.

name: Furu-utsubo
description: An animated jar.

name: Futakuchi-onna
description: The two-mouthed woman.

name: Gazu Hyakki Yagyō|Gagoze
description: A demon who attacked young priests at Gangō-ji temple.

name: Gaki
description: Starving ghosts of especially greedy people.

name: Gashadokuro
description: A giant skeleton that is the spirit of the unburied dead. Also known as Gaikotsu.

name: Genbu
description: Japanese version of the Chinese Black Tortoise.

name: Goryō
description: The vengeful spirits of the dead.

name: Gozu and Mezu
description: Underworld guards.

name: Guhin
description: Another name for tengu.

name: Gyūki
description: Another name for Ushioni.

name: Hakuja no Myojin
description: A White Serpent God.

name: Hakutaku
description: A beast which handed down knowledge on harmful spirits.

name: Hannya
description: A noh mask representing a jealous female demon.

name: Harionago
description: A woman with a thorn-like barb on the tip of each strand of her hair.

name: Hashihime
description: A woman-turned-spirit associated with the bridge at Uji.

name: Heikegani
description: Crabs with human-faced shells. They are the spirits of the warriors killed in the Battle of Dan-no-ura.

name: Hibagon
description: The Japanese version of Bigfoot.

name: Hiderigami
description: The spirit of drought.

name: Hihi
description: A baboon-like Chinese yokai.

name: Hikeshibaba
description: An old woman who extinguishes lanterns.

name: Hitodama
description: A fireball ghost that appears when someone dies, signifying the dead person's spirit.

name: Hitotsume-kozō
description: A one-eyed child spirit.

name: Hitotsume-nyūdō
description: A one-eyed monk spirit.

name: Hiyoribō
description: The spirit which stops rainfall.

name: Hoji
description: The wicked spirit of Tamamo-no-Mae.

name: Hone-onna
description: A skeleton-woman.

name: Hō-ō
description: The legendary Fenghuang bird of China.

name: Hoshi-no-Tama
description: A ball guarded by a Kitsune which can give the one who obtains it power to force the Kitsune to help them. It is said to hold some reserves of the Kitsune's power.

name: Hōsōshi
description: A ritual exorcist.

name: Hotoke
description: A deceased person.

name: Hyakki Yakō
description: The demons' night parade.

name: Hyōsube
description: A kind of hair-covered Kappa.

name: Ibaraki-doji
description: Offspring of an oni.

name: Ichiren-Bozu
description: Animated prayer beads.

name: Ikiryō
description: Essentially a living ghost, as it is a living person's soul outside of their body.

name: Ikuchi
description: Sea-serpent that travels over boats in an arc while dripping oil.

name: Inugami
description: A dog-spirit created, worshipped, and employed by a family via sorcery.

name: Inugami Gyoubu
description: A type of tanuki.

name: Isonade
description: A fish-like sea monster with a barb-covered tail.

name: Issie
description: A lake monster.

name: Itsumade
description: A fire-breathing bird-like monster.

name: Ittan-momen
description: A possessed roll of cotton that attempts to smother people by wrapping itself around their faces.

name: Iyaya
description: A woman whose face is reflected as an old man.

name: Janjanbi
description: A soul in the form of a ball of fire, named for the sound it makes.

name: Jibakurei
description: A spirit that protects a specific place.

name: Jikininki
description: Ghosts that eat human corpses.

name: Jinmenju
description: A tree with human-faced fruits.

name: Jishin-namazu
description: The giant catfish that causes earthquakes and tsunami. It was blamed during the Ansei quake & tsunami.

name: Jorōgumo
description: A spider-woman.

name: Jatai
description: Animated folding screen cloth

name: Jubokko
description: A vampiric tree.

name: Kahaku
description: Another name for a Kappa.

name: Kamaitachi
description: The slashing sickle-clawed weasel that haunts the mountains.

name: Kambarinyōdō
description: A monk spirit that spies on people using the toilet.

name: Kameosa
description: A possessed sake jar.

name: Kanedama
description: A spirit that carries money.

name: Kappa
description: A famous water monster with a water-filled head and a love of cucumbers.

name: Karasu-tengu
description: Crow demon.

name: Karura
description: Anthropomorphic eagle akin to the Hindu Garuda.

name: Kasa-obake
description: A possessed paper umbrella monster.

name: Kasha
description: A cat-like demon that descends from the sky and carries away corpses.

name: Katawaguruma
description: A type of Wanyudo, with an anguished woman instead of a monk's head in a burning wheel.

name: Kawauso
description: River otters.

name: Kawaakago
description: A river spirit that pretends to be a crying baby.

name: Kechibi
description: Fireballs with human faces inside.

name: Keneō
description: An old man seated in the underworld who weighs the clothes given to him by Datsue-ba.

name: Keukegen
description: A small dog-like creature covered entirely in long hair.

name: Kijimuna
description: A tree sprite from Okinawa.

name: Qilin|Kirin
description: The Japanese version of the Qilin of China, which is part dragon and part deer with antlers, fish scales and a ox's tail. Said to be a protective creature and the guardian of the metal element.

name: Kitsune
description: A fox spirit.

name: Kitsunebi
description: Flames created by the Kitsune.

name: Kiyohime
description: A woman who transformed into a serpent demon out of the rage of unrequited love.

name: Kodama
description: A spirit that lives in a tree.

name: Kokakuchō
description: The Ubume bird.

name: Komainu
description: The pair of lion-dogs that guard the entrances of temples.

name: Konaki-jiji
description: This yokai disguises itself as an abandoned baby then cries until someone picks it up.

name: Konoha-tengu
description: A bird-like Tengu.

name: Koropokkuru
description: A little person from Ainu folklore.

name: Kosenjōbi
description: Fireballs that float over former battlefields.

name: Kosode-no-te
description: A possessed kosode.

name: Kubikajiri
description: Female corpse-chewing graveyard spirit.

name: Kuchisake-onna
description: The slit-mouthed woman.

name: Kuda-gitsune
description: A small fox-like animal used in sorcery.

name: Kyonshī
description: The Japanese version of the Chinese hopping vampire, known as "jiangshi".

name: Kumo Yōkai
description: A Japanese spider demon.

name: Kyōkotsu
description: A skeletal figure that emerges from a well.

name: Kyōrinrin
description: Possessed scrolls or papers.

name: Mekurabe
description: The multiplying skulls that menaced Taira no Kiyomori in his courtyard.

name: Miage-nyūdō
description: A spirit that grows as fast as you can look up at it.

name: Mikaribaba
description: A one-eyed old woman.

name: Mikoshi-nyūdō
description: A bald goblin with an extending neck.

name: Misaki
description: High-ranking divine spirits.

name: Mizuchi
description: A dangerous water dragon.

name: Mokumokuren
description: A swarm of eyes that appear on a paper sliding door in an old building.

name: Mononoke
description: Any mischievous and troublesome creature/entity of uncertain origin.

name: Morinji-no-kama
description: Another name for Bunbuku Chagama, the tanuki teakettle.

name: Mujina
description: A shapeshifting badger.

name: Mu-onna
description: The nothing woman.

name: Myōbu
description: A title sometimes given to a fox.

name: Namahage
description: A ritual-disciplinary demon from the Oga Peninsula.

name: Namazu (Japanese mythology)|Namazu
description: A giant catfish that causes earthquakes.

name: Nekomata
description: A cat yokai.

name: Ningyo
description: A fish person or "mermaid".

name: Nobusuma
description: A flying squirrel-like monster.

name: Noderabō
description: Strange creatures that stand near a temple bell.

name: Noppera-bō
description: A faceless ghost.

name: Nozuchi
description: A fat snake-like creature.

name: Nue
description: A monster with the head of a monkey, the body of a raccoon dog, the legs of a tiger, and a snake-headed tail. It plagued the emperor with nightmares in the Heike Monogatari.

name: Nukekubi
description: A vicious human-like monster whose head detaches from its body, often confused with the Rokurokubi.

name: Nuppeppo
description: An animated lump of decaying human flesh.

name: Nure-onna
description: A female snake-like monster who appears on the shore.

name: Nuribotoke
description: An animated corpse with blackened flesh and dangling eyeballs.

name: Nurikabe
description: A ghostly wall that traps a traveler at night.

name: Nurarihyon
description: A strange character who sneaks into houses on busy evenings.

name: Nyūdō-bōzu
description: A yokai that grows larger the further one looks up.

name: Obake
description: Shapeshifting spirits.

name: Obariyon
description: Yokai which rides piggyback on a human victim and becomes unbearably heavy.

name: Oboroguruma
description: An oxen cart with a face in its carriage.

name: Oiwa
description: The ghost of a woman with a distorted face who was murdered by her husband. One of the most famous onryō.

name: Okiku
description: The plate-counting ghost of a servant girl.

name: Ōkubi
description: The huge face of a woman which appears in the sky.

name: Okuri-inu
description: A spectral dog which follows lone travellers, attacking them if they trip. Similar to the Black dog of English folklore

name: Ōmagatoki
description: Dusk.

name: Ōmukade
description: Giant, human-eating centipede that lives in the mountains.

name: Oni
description: The classic Japanese demon. It is an ogre-like creature which often has horns.

name: Onibaba
description: The demonic hag of Adachigahara.

name: Onibi
description: A demonic flame which can suck out life if they come too near.

name: Onihitokuchi
description: One-eyed oni that kill and eat humans.

name: Onmoraki
description: Bird-demon created from the spirits of freshly dead corpses.

name: Ōnyūdō
description: Wastebasket taxon for all 'priestly' demons.

name: Onryō
description: A vengeful ghost formed from powerful feelings like rage or sorrow.

name: Otoroshi
description: A hairy creature that perches on the torii gates to shrines and temples.

name: Onmyoji
description: A human who has powers like a yokai's.

name: Raijin
description: The God of Thunder.

name: Raijū
description: A beast that falls to earth in a lightning bolt.

name: Rokurokubi
description: A person, usually female, whose neck can stretch indefinitely.

name: Ryuu
description: The Japanese dragon.

name: Sa Gojō
description: The water-monster Sha Wujing from Journey to the West, often interpreted in Japan as a Kappa.

name: Samebito
description: A shark-man from the undersea Dragon Palace.

name: Sankai
description: Amorphous afterbirth spirit.

name: Satori
description: An ape-like creature that can read minds.

name: Sazae-oni
description: A turban snail that turns into a woman.

name: Sesshō-seki
description: The poisonous "killing stones" which Tamamo-no-Mae transformed into.

name: Seiryū
description: Japanese version of the Chinese Azure Dragon.

name: Shachihoko
description: A tiger-headed fish whose image is often used in architecture.

name: Shibaemon-tanuki
description: A tanuki from Awaji Island.

name: Shichinin misaki
description: A group of 7 ghosts who sicken the living.

name: Shidaidaka
description: A humanoid yokai that appears above roads.

name: Shikigami
description: A spirit summoned to do the bidding of an Onmyōji.

name: Shikome
description: Wild women sent by Izanami to harm Izanagi.

name: Shinigami
description: The Japanese Grim Reaper.

name: Shiranui
description: a mysterious flame seen over the seas in Kumamoto Prefecture.

name: Shirime
description: An apparition in the shape of a man having an eye in the place of his anus.

name: Shirōneri
description: Possessed mosquito nettings or dust clothes.

name: Shiryō
description: The souls of the dead, the opposite of ikiryo.

name: Shisa
description: The Okinawan version of the Shishi.

name: Shishi
description: The paired lion-dogs that guard the entrances of temples.

name: Shōjō
description: Red-haired sea sprites who love alcohol.

name: Shōkera
description: Is a creature which peeks in through the skylight of an old house.

name: Sōjōbō
description: The famous Daitengu of Mount Kurama.

name: Suiko
description: Another name for Kappa.

name: Sun Wukong|Son Gokū
description: The monkey king Sun Wukong from Journey to the West.

name: Sunakake Baba
description: A witch who uses sand.

name: Sunekosuri
description: A catlike yokai that rubs up against people's legs when it is raining.

name: Suzaku
description: Japanese version of the Chinese Vermilion Bird.

name: Taka-onna
description: A female monster that can stretch its waist to peer inside buildings.

name: Tamamo-no-Mae
description: A wicked nine-tailed fox who appeared as a courtesan.

name: Tanuki
description: A shape-shifting raccoon dog.

name: Teke Teke
description: A vengeful spirit of a school girl, with a half upper torso body, who goes around killing people by slicing them in half with a scythe, mimicking her own disfigurement.

name: Tengu
description: A wise bird-like demon.

name: Tennin
description: A heavenly being.

name: Te-no-me
description: A ghost of a blind man with his eyes on his hands.

name: Gazu Hyakki Yagyō|Tesso
description: A priest who was snubbed by the emperor and became a swarm of rats which laid waste to a rival temple.

name: Tōfu-kozō
description: A yokai that appears as a young boy carrying a plate of tofu.

name: Tsuchigumo
description: A clan of spider-like yokai.

name: Tsuchinoko
description: A legendary serpentine monster. It is now a cryptid resembling a fat snake.

name: Tsukinowaguma
description: A legendary bear.<ref>Clarissa Pinkola Estés, Women who Run with the Wolves (1996), Ch. 12.</ref>

name: Tsukuyomi
description: A moon god.

name: Tsukumogami
description: An animated tea caddy that Matsunaga Hisahide used to bargain a peace with Oda Nobunaga. It is now understood to mean any 100-year-old inanimate object that has come to life.

name: Tsurube-otoshi
description: A monster that drops out of the tops of trees.

name: Ubume
description: The spirit of a woman who died in childbirth.

name: Uma-no-ashi
description: A horse's leg which dangles from a tree and kicks passersby.

name: Umibōzu
description: A giant monster appearing on the surface of the sea.

name: Umi-nyōbō
description: A female sea monster who steals fish.

name: Ungaikyo
description: A possessed mirror.

name: Ushi-oni
description: A name given to an assortment of ox-headed monsters.

name: Uwan
description: A spirit named for the sound it shouts when surprising people.

name: Waira
description: A large beast that lurks in the mountains, about which little is known.

name: Wani
description: A water monster comparable to an alligator or crocodile. A related word has been applied to the Saltwater crocodile.

name: Wanyūdō
description: A flaming wheel with a man's head in the center, that sucks out the soul of anyone who sees it.

name: Yadōkai
description: Monks who have turned to mischief.

name: Yama-biko
description: Small creatures that create echoes.

name: Yamajijii
description: An old man with one eye and one leg.

name: Yamaoroshi
description: A possessed vegetable grater, almost porcupine-like in appearance.

name: Yamata no Orochi
description: The eight-headed dragon/serpent monster slain by the god Susanoo.

name: Yama-uba
description: A Crone-like yōkai.

name: Yashima no Hage-tanuki
description: A tanuki that protects the Taira clan.

name: Yatagarasu
description: The three-legged crow of Amaterasu.

name: Yato-no-kami
description: Deadly Snake Gods which infested a field.

name: Yobuko
description: A mountain-dwelling spirit.

name: Yomotsu-shikome
description: The hags of the underworld.

name: Yōsei
description: The Japanese word for "fairy".

name: Yosuzume
description: a mysterious bird that sings at night, sometimes indicating that the okuri-inu is near.

name: Yuki-onna
description: The snow woman.

name: Yurei
description: Ghosts in a more Western sense.

name: Zashiki-warashi
description: A protective childlike house spirit.

name: Zennyo Ryūō
description: A rain-making dragon.

name: Zorigami
description: An animated clock.

name: Zuijin
description: A tutelary spirit.

name: Zunbera-bō
description: Another name for the Noppera-bō.
